EmailTemplate.subject: Turbonomic Top Ten Features #2: Improve Overall Efficiency
EmailTemplate.textOnly:
Hi {{Lead.First Name}},
Here's your second of ten Turbonomic Top Features. Of course, if at any time you want to accelerate your learning, you can visit the Green Circle Community <[[https://greencircle.turbonomic.com/welcome?utm_source=vmturbo&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=ENG-HybridCloud&utm_content=Mid02]]> and gain tips and tricks from real Turbonomic customers and evaluators just like you. Feature #2: Improve Overall Efficiency
In addition to guaranteeing application performance, Turbonomic is capable of maximizing workload densities and infrastructure utilization. It provides you with with specific automatable actions, in real-time, that combined help you answer the following questions:
- How can I improve efficiency in my environment? - How can I save money? - How can I recover unused resources?
Step-By-Step: Improve Overall Efficiency
The following steps will guide you through the Improve Overall Efficiency Dashboard:
- To Do Actions in this dashboard specifically address efficiency opportunities - Virtual Machine Efficiency shows opportunities to reclaim resources on a cluster-by-cluster basis - Virtual Machine and Storage displays storage consumption by VM cluster and identifies Active, Dormant, Powered Off, and Other VMs
- Click Powered Off and then the Chart Icon to view the list of Powered Off VMs and the resources they are consuming
- Wasted Storage displays the amount of wasted storage for each storage type: iSCSI, Block, NAS, etc. and is hidden by default*
*To toggle Wasted Storage, go to Policy > Analysis > Global Storage Settings > Uncheck Disable Datastore Browsing
